src:
Pertumbuhan Ekonomi Indonesia Triwulan Ketiga Melambat
05 Nov 2019, 11:58 by Magdalena


Pertumbuhan Ekonomi Indonesia Triwulan Ketiga Melambat

KBRN, Jakarta :   Laporan Badan Pusat Statistik menunjukkan  pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia pada triwulan ke-3  tahun 2019 hanya sebesar 5,02 persen. Melambat dibandingkan pertumbuhan ekonomi di triwulan sebelumnya sebesar 5,05 persen.
Kepala BPS Suhariyanto dalam keterangannya di kantor BPS hari ini mengatakan, perlambatan pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia di triwulan ketiga tahun ini, tidak lepas dari pengaruh kondisi perekonomian global yang juga masih melambat dan masih diliputi ketidakpastian.
"Meski demikian dibandingkan negara-negara lain yang perekonomiannya juga mengalami kontraksi,  pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia di triwulan ketiga sebesar 5,02 persen  tidak terlalu curam,"  kata Suhariyanto di kantor BPS, Selasa (5/11/2019)
Pada triwulan ketiga ini, menurut laporan BPS, pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia masih ditopang utamanya oleh sektor konsumsi rumah tangga yang di triwulan ketiga ini tumbuh sebesar 2,69 persen.  Sektor lainnya yang mendukung pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia di triwulan ketiga adalah investasi yang tumbuh  sebesar 1,38 persen dan ekspor yang tumbuh sebesar 1.83 persen.
Dengan demikian, perekonomian Indonesia berdasarkan besaran Produk Domestik Bruto (PDB) atas dasar harga berlaku trowulan ke-3 tahun ini mencapai Rp. 4.067,8 triliun, dan atas dasar harga konstan 2010 mencapai Rp. 2.818,9 triliun.
text:
Indonesia's Third Quarter Economic Growth Slows
05 Nov 2019, 11:58 by Magdalena


Indonesia's Third Quarter Economic Growth Slows

KBRN, Jakarta: Central Statistics Agency report shows that Indonesia's economic growth in the 3rd quarter of 2019 was only 5.02 percent. Slower compared to economic growth in the previous quarter by 5.05 percent.
BPS head Suhariyanto in his statement at the BPS office today said that the slowdown in Indonesia's economic growth in the third quarter of this year was inseparable from the influence of global economic conditions which were also still slowing down and were still filled with uncertainty.
"Even so compared to other countries whose economies also experienced a contraction, Indonesia's economic growth in the third quarter of 5.02 percent was not too steep," Suhariyanto said at the BPS office, Tuesday (11/05/2019)
In the third quarter, according to the BPS report, Indonesia's economic growth was still supported mainly by the household consumption sector which grew by 2.69 percent in the third quarter. Other sectors that supported Indonesia's economic growth in the third quarter were investments that grew by 1.38 percent and exports grew by 1.83 percent.
Thus, the Indonesian economy based on the amount of Gross Domestic Product (GDP) based on current prices for the third year this year reaches Rp. 4,067.8 trillion, and based on 2010 constant prices it reached Rp. 2,818.9 trillion.
